en: And so I went. I slid out the window, and we ran along the side of my house, heads down, until we opened the doors of the minivan. We rolled slowly past a couple houses before I turned on the engine and the headlights. en: Margo managed to speak in her usual manic soliloquy without answering my question. “Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement. There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for planning. No time for a future. But then the life spans started getting longer, and people started having more and more future, and so they spent more time thinking about it. About the future. And now life has become the future. En el futuro. Y ahora la vida se ha convertido en el futuro. Vives cada instante de tu vida por el futuro… Vas al instituto para poder ir a la universidad, y así podrás encontrar un buen trabajo, y así podrás comprarte una bonita casa, y así podrás permitirte mandar a tus hijos a la universidad para que puedan encontrar un buen trabajo y así puedan comprarse una bonita casa y así puedan permitirse mandar a sus hijos a la universidad.

es: Nos alejábamos del coche cuando Margo me cogió de la mano, entrelazó sus dedos con los míos y los apretó. Le devolví el apretón y la miré. Movió la cabeza solemnemente, volví a apretar y me soltó la mano. Corrimos hasta la ventana. Empujé hacia arriba despacio el marco de madera. Chirrió un poco, pero se abrió a la primera. Eché un vistazo. Aunque estaba oscuro, vi a alguien en una cama.
vi_translation: We got out of the car and walked side by side, Margo reached out and held my hand, intertwining her fingers with mine, and squeezed tightly. I also squeezed my hand and glanced at her. Margo quietly nodded, I nodded back, and she released my hand. We quickly approached the window. I gently pushed the wooden frame up. It made a slight noise, but it opened right away. I looked inside. It was too dark, but I saw someone lying on the bed.
tr_translation: When Margo reached out and intertwined her fingers with mine, we were walking away from the car together. I squeezed hers and looked at her. She nodded seriously, I nodded back, and then she let go of my hand. We quickly climbed out the window. I gently pushed the wooden frame up. It creaked very little but opened in one motion. I looked inside. It was dark, but I could see someone in the bed.
es_translation: We were walking away from the car when Margo took my hand, intertwined her fingers with mine, and squeezed. I squeezed back and looked at her. She nodded solemnly, I squeezed again, and she let go of my hand. We ran to the window. I slowly pushed the wooden frame up. It creaked a little, but it opened on the first try. I took a look inside. Although it was dark, I saw someone on a bed.

en: The window was a little high for Margo, so I put my hands together and she stepped a socked foot onto my hand and I boosted her up. Her silent entrance into the house would have made a ninja jealous. I proceeded to jump up, get my head and shoulders into the window, and then attempt, via a complicated torso undulation, to dance the caterpillar into the house. That might have worked fine except I racked my balls against the windowsill, which hurt so bad that I groaned, which was a pretty sizable mistake.
vi: Cửa sổ hơi cao so với Margo, nên tôi chắp tay để cô ấy dận một chân đi bít tất lên, và tôi đẩy Margo lên. Cô ấy vào trong êm ái đến mức ninja thứ thiệt chắc cũng phải ghen tị. Tôi nhảy lên, chui được đầu và vai qua cửa sổ, rồi với nỗ lực xoắn vặn cơ thể, tôi uốn éo như sâu lùn chùn bò vào trong. Sự thể lẽ ra đã suôn sẻ, nếu tôi không lỡ cọ hai quả trứng cò vào bậu cửa sổ, đau tê tái đến mức tôi không nén nổi rên rẩm, gây ra một sai lầm vô cùng tệ hại.
tr: Pencere Margo için biraz yüksekti, bu yüzden ellerimi birleştirdim, Margo çoraplı ayağıyla elimin üstüne bastı ve onu yukarı doğru ittim. Sessizce eve girişi bir ninjayı kıskandınrdı. Bense yukan zıplayıp başımı ve omuzlarımı pencereye ulaştırmaya, karmaşık bir vücut dalgalanması yoluyla, tırtıl gibi dans ederek evin içine girmeye çalıştım. Her şey iyi gitmiş olabilirdi, yalnız hayalarım pencere eşiğine takıldı ve acıdan inledim ki bu oldukça büyük bir hataydı.
es: Como la ventana estaba un poco alta para Margo, junté las manos, puso un pie encima y la impulsé. Su silenciosa entrada en la casa habría sido la envidia de un ninja. Me dispuse a subir, metí la cabeza y los hombros por la ventana, y pretendía, mediante una complicada contorsión, entrar en la casa en plan oruga. Podría haber funcionado perfectamente de no haberme aplastado los huevos contra la repisa, y me dolió tanto que solté un quejido, lo cual suponía un error nada desdeñable.
vi_translation: The window was a bit high for Margo, so I clasped my hands for her to step on with one socked foot, and I pushed Margo up. She got in so smoothly that even a real ninja would be envious. I jumped up, got my head and shoulders through the window, and with a twisting effort, I wriggled like a worm to get inside. Things would have gone smoothly if I hadn't accidentally brushed my two eggs against the window sill, causing such excruciating pain that I couldn't help but groan, leading to a terribly bad mistake.
tr_translation: The window was a bit high for Margo, so I clasped my hands together, Margo stepped on my hand with her socked foot, and I pushed her up. It could have worked perfectly if I hadn't crushed my balls against the ledge, and it hurt so much that I let out a groan, which was no small mistake.

en: A bedside light came on. And there, lying in bed, was some old guy—decidedly not Chuck Parson. His eyes were wide with terror; he didn’t say a thing.
vi: Đèn ở đầu giường bật sáng. Người nằm trên giường là một bác trai có tuổi–rõ ràng không phải Chuck Parson. Bác ta tròn mắt kinh hãi và không nói nổi lời nào.
tr: Bir başucu lambası yandı. Ve orada, yatakta yatan, yaşlı bir adamdı... açık bir şekilde Chuck Parson değildi. Gözleri dehşetle açılmıştı; hiçbir şey söylemedi.
es: Se encendió la luz de la mesita. Y resultó que el que estaba en la cama era un viejo, sin duda no era Chuck Parson. Abrió los ojos como platos, aterrorizado. No dijo una palabra.
vi_translation: The bedside lamp turned on. The person lying on the bed was an elderly man—clearly not Chuck Parson. He widened his eyes in horror and couldn't utter a word.
tr_translation: A bedside lamp turned on. And there, lying in bed, was an old man... it was clearly not Chuck Parson. His eyes were wide with terror; he said nothing.
es_translation: The light on the bedside table turned on. And it turned out that the one in the bed was an old man, certainly not Chuck Parson. He opened his eyes wide, terrified. He didn't say a word.

en: “I think we share the blame on that one,” Margo said.
vi: “Vụ vừa rồi cả hai đứa mình đều ấm ớ,” Margo nói.
tr: “Bence bu seferki suçu paylaşıyoruz,” dedi Margo.
es: —Creo que esta vez la culpa es de los dos —dijo Margo.
vi_translation: "We both messed up last time," Margo said.
tr_translation: "I think we're sharing the blame this time," said Margo.
es_translation: —I think this time it's both of our faults —said Margo.

en: “I need you to use Radar’s login to the student directory and look up an address. Chuck Parson.”
vi: “Tôi cần ông dùng tài khoản của Radar đăng nhập vào danh bạ của trường và tra một địa chỉ. Chuck Parson.
tr: “Radar’m öğrenci sistemine giriş şifresini kullamp bir adrese bakman lazım. Chuck Parson.
es: —Necesito que entres en la página del instituto con la contraseña de Radar y me busques una dirección. Chuck Parson.
vi_translation: “I need you to use Radar's account to log into the school's directory and look up an address. Chuck Parson.”
tr_translation: "You need to use Radar's student system login password to check an address." Chuck Parson."
es_translation: —I need you to log into the institute's website with Radar's password and find me an address. Chuck Parson.

en: “Yeah, yeah, I just did it. I was doing it while saying no—can’t help but help. Four-two-two Amherst. Hey, why do you want Chuck Parson’s address at four-twelve in the morning?”
vi: “Rồi rồi, làm xong rồi đó. Tôi đã làm trong khi nói không rồi đó–không thể làm gì ngoài giúp đỡ há. Bốn-hai-hai Amherst. Này, thế quái nào mà ông lại cần địa chỉ của Chuck Parson vào lúc bốn giờ mười hai phút sáng vậy?”
tr: “Evet evet, az önce yaptım. Hayır derken yapıyordum, yardım etmekten başka çarem yok. 422 Amherst. Hey, sabahın dört buçuğunda neden Chuck Parson’m adresini istiyorsun?
es: —Sí, sí. Ya está. Estaba entrando mientras te decía que no… No puedo evitar ayudarte. Amherst, 422. Oye, ¿para qué necesitas la dirección de Chuck Parson a las cuatro y doce de la mañana?
vi_translation: “Alright, alright, it's done. I did it while saying no–can't do anything but help, huh. Four-two-two Amherst. Hey, why the heck do you need the address of Chuck Parson at twelve minutes past four in the morning?
tr_translation: “Yes, yes, I just did it. I was doing it while saying no, I have no choice but to help. 422 Amherst. Hey, why are you asking for Chuck Parson’s address at four-thirty in the morning?”
es_translation: —Yes, yes. It's done. I was coming in while I was telling you no... I can't help but assist you. Amherst, 422. Hey, why do you need Chuck Parson's address at four twelve in the morning?

en: Margo glanced at her watch and held up two fingers. We waited. And for those two minutes we just stared at each other, and I watched the blue in her eyes. It was nice—in the dark and the quiet, with no possibility of me saying anything to screw it up, and her eyes looking back, like there was something in me worth seeing.
vi: Margo liếc đồng hồ và giơ hai ngón tay lên. Chúng tôi đợi. Trong hai phút ấy hai đứa chỉ nhìn nhau, và tôi nhìn màu xanh trong mắt cô ấy. Thật tuyệt–trong bóng tối và không gian yên tĩnh, không có nguy cơ tôi sẽ vạ miệng nói lung tung làm hỏng khung cảnh, và đôi mắt cô ấy nhìn lại tôi, như thể có gì đó ở tôi đáng được nhìn vậy.
tr: Margo saatine bir göz attı ve iki parmağını yukarı kaldırdı. Bekledik. O iki dakika boyunca sadece birbirimize gözlerimizi dikip baktık ve ben onun gözlerindeki maviliği izledim. Çok hoştu... karanlık ve sessizlik, her şeyi mahvedecek bir şey söyleme ihtimalim olmadan. Ve onun gözleri de bana bakıyordu, sanki bende görmeye değer bir şey varmış gibi.
es: Margo echó un vistazo a su reloj y levantó dos dedos. Esperamos. Y durante dos minutos nos quedamos mirándonos. Yo observé el azul de sus ojos. Fue bonito. A oscuras y en silencio, sin la posibilidad de que yo dijera algo y metiera la pata, y ella me devolvía la mirada, como si hubiera algo en mí que merecía la pena ver.
vi_translation: Margo glanced at the clock and raised two fingers. We waited. During those two minutes, we just looked at each other, and I gazed into the blue of her eyes. It was wonderful—in the darkness and quiet space, there was no risk of me saying something foolish to ruin the moment, and her eyes looked back at me, as if there was something in me worth looking at.
tr_translation: Margo glanced at her watch and raised two fingers. We waited. During those two minutes, we just stared into each other's eyes, and I watched the blueness in her eyes. It was very nice... darkness and silence, without the possibility of me saying something that would ruin everything. And her eyes were looking at me too, as if there was something worth seeing in me.
es_translation: Margo glanced at her watch and raised two fingers. We waited. And for two minutes we just stared at each other. I observed the blue of her eyes. It was beautiful. In the dark and in silence, without the possibility of me saying something and messing it up, and she returned my gaze, as if there was something in me worth seeing.

en: “You’re just a really loud, awkward ninja,” Margo said, “but we are both ninjas.” She tucked her hair behind her ears, pulled up her hood, and scrunched it shut with a drawstring; the streetlight lit up the sharp features of her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but only she had the outfit.
vi: “Cậu là chàng ninja ồn ào và lắm chuyện,” Margo nói, “nhưng hai đứa mình đều là ninja.” Cô ấy vén tóc ra sau vành tai, đội mũ lên, thít chặt dây rút; ánh sáng từ ngọn đèn đường rọi lên những nét sắc sảo trên khuôn mặt nhợt nhạt của cô ấy. Có thể cả hai đứa tôi đều là ninja, nhưng chỉ Margo mặc trang phục thích hợp.
tr: “Sen sadece gerçekten gürültücü, sakar bir ninjasın,” dedi Margo, “ama ikimiz de ninjayız.” Saçını kulaklarının arkasına attı; kapüşonunu başma çekip ipiyle hışırdatarak büzdü; sokak lambası solgun yüzünün keskin hatlarını aydınlatıyordu. Belki ikimiz de ninjaydık fakat ekipmanı olan yalnızca oydu.
es: —Los dos somos ninjas, solo que tú eres un ninja torpe y ruidoso —dijo Margo. Se colocó el pelo detrás de las orejas, se puso la capucha y se la ató con el cordón. La farola iluminó los agudos rasgos de su cara pálida. Quizá los dos éramos ninjas, pero solo ella lo parecía.
vi_translation: “You are the noisy and talkative ninja,” Margo said, “but we are both ninjas.” She tucked her hair behind her ear, put on her hat, and tightened the drawstring; the light from the streetlamp illuminated the sharp features on her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but only Margo was dressed appropriately.
tr_translation: “You’re just a really noisy, clumsy ninja,” said Margo, “but we’re both ninjas.” She tucked her hair behind her ears; pulled her hood over her head and tightened it with a rustle; the street lamp illuminated the sharp features of her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but she was the only one with equipment.
es_translation: —We are both ninjas, only you are a clumsy and noisy ninja —said Margo. She tucked her hair behind her ears, put on the hood, and tied it with the cord. The streetlamp illuminated the sharp features of her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but only she looked like one.

en: “Okay,” she said. “Memorize the map.” By far the most terrifying part of the half-mile-long journey Margo had plotted for us was the moat. SeaWorld was shaped like a triangle. One side was protected by a road, which Margo figured was regularly patrolled by night watchmen. The second side was guarded by a lake that was at least a mile around, and the third side had a drainage ditch; from the map, it looked to be about as wide as a two-lane road. And where there are water-filled drainage ditches near lakes in Florida, there are often alligators.
vi: “Được rồi,” cô ấy nói. “Ghi nhớ bản đồ nhé.” Đến thời điểm này, phần gian nguy nhất trong hành trình nửa dặm mà Margo đã vạch ra chính là hào nước. Địa hình SeaWorld như một tam giác. Một cạnh là mặt đường, Margo suy luận rằng sẽ thường xuyên có nhân viên an ninh đi tuần tra ban đêm. Cạnh thứ hai sát với một hồ nước chu vi ít nhất một dặm, và cạnh thứ ba tiếp giáp hào thoát nước. Nhìn từ bản đồ, hào nước này rộng cỡ một con đường hai làn. Và ở Florida, ở đâu có hào thoát nước cạnh hồ, ở đó thường có cá sấu.
tr: ‘Tamam,” dedi. “Haritayı ezberle.” Margo’nun bizim için kurguladığı yaklaşık bir kilometrelik yolculuğun açık ara farkla en korkutucu bölümü hendekti. SeaWorld üçgen şeklindeydi. Bir tarafı, Margo’nun yürüttüğü tahmine göre, gece bekçilerinin devriye gezdiği bir cadde tarafından korunuyordu, ikinci taraf, çevresi en az bir kilometre olan bir göl tarafından gözetiliyordu ve üçüncü tarafta bir drenaj kanalı vardı; haritada yaklaşık iki şeritli bir yol kadar geniş görünüyordu. Ve Florida’da, göllerin yakınında suyla dolu drenaj kanalları varsa, orada genellikle timsahlar olur.
es: —Bien —me dijo—, memoriza el mapa. La parte más terrorífica del recorrido de casi un kilómetro que Margo había trazado era, con diferencia, el foso. El SeaWorld tenía forma triangular. Un lado estaba protegido por una carretera por la que Margo suponía que patrullaban permanentemente vigilantes nocturnos. El segundo lado estaba protegido por un lago de casi dos kilómetros de perímetro, y en el tercero había una zanja de drenaje. Según el mapa, parecía tener la anchura de una carretera de dos carriles. Y en Florida, en las zanjas de drenaje junto a los lagos suele haber caimanes.
vi_translation: “Alright,” she said. “Remember the map.” At this point, the most perilous part of the half-mile journey Margo had outlined was the moat. The terrain of SeaWorld was like a triangle. One side was the road, which Margo reasoned would frequently have security personnel patrolling at night. The second side bordered a lake with a circumference of at least a mile, and the third side adjoined a drainage ditch. From the map, this moat appeared to be as wide as a two-lane road. And in Florida, where there is a drainage ditch next to a lake, there are often alligators.
tr_translation: ‘Okay,’ he said. ‘Memorize the map.’ The most terrifying part by far of the roughly one-kilometer journey Margo had planned for us was the ditch. SeaWorld was triangular in shape. One side, according to Margo's estimation, was guarded by a street patrolled by night watchmen, the second side was watched over by a lake with a circumference of at least one kilometer, and the third side had a drainage channel; on the map, it appeared to be about two lanes wide. It looked as wide as a road. And in Florida, if there are drainage canals filled with water near the lakes, there are usually alligators there.

One side was protected by a road on which Margo assumed night watchmen patrolled permanently. The second side was protected by a lake with a perimeter of almost two kilometers, and on the third side, there was a drainage ditch. According to the map, it seemed to be as wide as a two-lane road. And in Florida, drainage ditches next to lakes usually have alligators.

en: Margo grabbed me by both shoulders and turned me toward her. “We’re going to get caught, probably, and when we do, just let me talk. You just look cute and be that weird mix of innocent and confident, and we’ll be fine.”
vi: Margo đặt cả tay lên hai vai tôi và xoay tôi lại phía cô ấy. “Bọn mình sẽ bị tóm, có thể thôi, trong trường hợp đó, cứ để tớ nói mọi chuyện. Cậu chỉ cần tỏ ra hiền hiền kiểu nửa ngây thơ nửa thẳng thắn, rồi ta sẽ ổn cả thôi.”
tr: Margo beni iki omzumdan tutup kendine çevirdi. “Muhtemelen yakalanacağız ve yakalandığımızda bırak ben konuşayım. Sen sadece şirin görünüp şu tuhaf masumkendinden emin tavrını sergilersen, her şey yolunda gider.
es: Margo me agarró por los hombros y me giró hacia ella. —Seguramente nos pillarán, así que, cuando nos pillen, déjame hablar a mí. Tú limítate a poner cara de bueno, medio inocente, medio seguro de ti mismo, y todo irá bien.
vi_translation: Margo put both hands on my shoulders and turned me to face her. "We might get caught, maybe, in that case, just let me do all the talking. You just need to act kind of innocent and straightforward, and we'll be fine."
tr_translation: Margo grabbed me by both shoulders and turned me towards her. “We will probably get caught, and when we do, let me do the talking. You just need to look cute and display that weirdly innocent yet confident demeanor of yours, and everything will be fine.”
es_translation: Margo grabbed me by the shoulders and turned me towards her. —Surely they will catch us, so when they do, let me do the talking. You just focus on looking good, half innocent, half confident, and everything will be fine.

en: We jogged across I-Drive and then started bushwhacking through a thicket of tall shrubs and oak trees. I started to worry about poison ivy, but ninjas don’t worry about poison ivy, so I led the trail, my arms in front of me, pushing aside briars and brush as we walked toward the moat. Finally the trees stopped and the field opened up, and I could see the parkway on our right and the moat straight ahead of us. People could have seen us from the road if there had been any cars, but there weren’t. Together we took off running through the brush, and then made a sharp turn toward the parkway. Margo said, “Now, now!” and I dashed across the six lanes of highway. Even though it was empty, something felt exhilarating and wrong about running across a road that big.
vi: Chúng tôi đi bộ qua I-Drive, bắt đầu mò đường qua đám sồi rậm rạp và cây bụi lùm xùm. Tôi hơi lo về độc tố của cây thường xuân, nhưng ninja không sợ độc tố thường xuân, thế là tôi xông lên, cánh tay giơ trước mặt, gạt cành gai lá lẻo sang hai bên để tiến về phía hào nước. Cuối cùng cũng qua được vạt cây và tầm nhìn thoáng ra, tôi thấy con đường với hàng cây ở bên tay phải và hào nước thẳng phía trước mặt. Ai ngồi trong xe trên đường hẳn sẽ nhìn thấy chúng tôi, nhưng chẳng có chiếc xe nào cả. Chúng tôi cùng chạy qua bụi rậm, rẽ ngoặt về phía hàng cây. Margo nói, “Nào, nào!” và tôi xẹt qua đường cao tốc sáu làn xe. Dù trên đường hoàn toàn không có ma nào, trong tôi vẫn dội lên cơn phấn khích và cảm giác sai trái to đùng khi chạy cắt qua một con đường lớn đến vậy.
tr: 1Bulvan’nın öteki tarafına koştuk, sonra uzun çalılar ile meşelerden oluşan yeşilliğin içinde pusuya yattık. Zehirli sarmaşık hakkında endişelenmeye başlamıştım ama ninjalar zehirli sarmaşık hakkında endişelenmeyecekleri için hendeğe doğru yürürken, kollarım önde, dikenli çalılan ve fundalığı kenara iterek öncülük ettim. Nihayet ağaçlar bitti ve meydan ortaya çıktı, böylece sağımdaki bulvarı ve tam karşımızda olan hendeği görebildim. Eğer birkaç araba olsaydı, insanlar yoldan bizi görebilirlerdi ama hiç araba yoktu. Birlikte yeşilliklerin arasından koşmak için harekete geçtik ve sonra bulvara doğru keskin bir dönüş yaptık. Margo, “Şimdi, şimdi!” dedi ve ben fırlayıp anayolun altı şeridini geçtim. Yol boş olduğu halde, bu kadar büyük bir caddeyi koşarak geçmekle ilgili bir şey hem heyecan verici hem de yanlışmış gibi geliyordu.
es: Corrimos por International Drive y luego nos abrimos camino entre arbustos altos y robles. Empecé a preocuparme por la hiedra venenosa, pero los ninjas no se preocupan por esas cosas, así que me coloqué a la cabeza, con los brazos extendidos, y aparté las zarzas y la maleza mientras avanzábamos hacia el foso. Al final se acabó la zona de árboles y llegamos a campo abierto. Veía la autopista a nuestra derecha y el foso justo enfrente. Podrían habernos visto desde la carretera si hubiera pasado algún coche, pero no pasó ninguno. Corrimos por la maleza y trazamos una curva cerrada hacia la autopista. —¡Ahora! ¡Ahora! —exclamó Margo.
