tr: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Bugün New York’tan birisi Omnictionary’de Margo Roth Spiegelman’ı aramış.
es: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Alguien de Nueva York ha buscado hoy a Margo Roth Spiegelman en el Omnictionary.

tr_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Today, someone from New York searched for Margo Roth Spiegelman on Omnictionary.
es_translation: OMNICTIONARIAN96: Someone from New York searched for Margo Roth Spiegelman on the Omnictionary today.

en: “No,” I said. “No way.” I knew Margo better than that by now. She did want attention. I believed that. But Margo didn’t play life for laughs. She didn’t get off on mere trickery.
vi: “Không,” tôi nói. “Không thể nào.” Bây giờ tôi đã hiểu Margo rõ hơn. Cô ấy muốn được chú ý. Tôi tin như vậy. Nhưng Margo không đùa với sinh mạng để mua vui. Cô ấy không bỏ đi chỉ để chơi khăm như vậy.
tr: “Hayır,” dedim. “Mümkün değil.” Şimdiye kadar Margo’yu bundan daha iyi tanımıştım. İlgi istiyordu. Buna inanırdım. Ama Margo eğlence olsun diye hayatla oynamazdı. Salt düzenbazlıktan zevk almazdı.
es: —No —le dije—. Imposible. Ya conocía mejor a Margo. Sí que creía que le gustaba llamar la atención, pero Margo no se tomaba la vida a risa. No se había quitado de en medio para engañarnos.
vi_translation: “No,” I said. “No way.” Now I understand Margo better. She wants to be noticed. I believe so. But Margo doesn't joke with life to have fun. She didn't leave just to play a prank like that.
tr_translation: “No,” I said. “It's not possible.” By now, I had known Margo better than this. She wanted attention. I believed that. But Margo wouldn't play with life just for fun. She didn't take pleasure in sheer trickery.
es_translation: —No —I said—. Impossible. I already knew Margo better. I did believe that she liked to attract attention, but Margo did not take life lightly. She hadn't disappeared to deceive us.

en: I put the book down and lay on my side, staring out the window that had always been between us. It is not enough just to see her or hear her. To find Margo Roth Spiegelman, you must become Margo Roth Spiegelman.
vi: Tôi đặt cuốn sách xuống và nằm nghiêng, nhìn ra ô cửa sổ đã luôn ở giữa tôi và cô ấy. Chỉ nhìn hoặc nghe thấy cô ấy là không đủ. Để tìm được Margo Roth Spiegelman, ta phải trở thành Margo Roth Spiegelman.
tr: Kitabı kenara koyup hep aramızda olan pencereden dışarı bakarak yan dönüyorum. Onu yalnızca görmek ya da duymak yeterli değil. Margo Roth Spiegelman’ı bulmak için Margo Roth Spiegelman olmalısınız.
es: Dejé el libro y me tumbé de lado, mirando por la ventana que siempre había estado entre nosotros. No basta con verla o escucharla. Para encontrar a Margo Roth Spiegelman tienes que convertirte en Margo Roth Spiegelman.
vi_translation: I put the book down and lay on my side, looking out the window that had always been between me and her. Just seeing or hearing her was not enough. To find Margo Roth Spiegelman, one must become Margo Roth Spiegelman.
tr_translation: I put the book aside and turn sideways to look outside through the window that has always been between us. It is not enough to just see or hear her. To find Margo Roth Spiegelman, you must become Margo Roth Spiegelman.
es_translation: I put down the book and lay on my side, looking through the window that had always been between us. It's not enough to see her or hear her. To find Margo Roth Spiegelman, you have to become Margo Roth Spiegelman.

en: Throughout the day, I found myself thinking that maybe this feeling was why she’d planned everything so intricately and precisely: even if you want to leave, it is so hard. It took preparation, and maybe sitting in that minimall scrawling her plans was both intellectual and emotional practice—Margo’s way of imagining herself into her fate.
vi: Suốt cả ngày, tôi đã nghĩ có lẽ chính cảm xúc này là lí do tại sao cô ấy lại lên kế hoạch tất cả thật chi tiết và chính xác: dù có muốn đi nữa, ra đi vẫn thật khó khăn. Cần được chuẩn bị, và có lẽ ngồi vạch kế hoạch trong khu mua sắm bỏ hoang đó là một việc vừa trí tuệ vừa đầy cảm xúc–cách Margo hình dung về chính mình dấn thân vào số phận.
tr: Gün boyunca, Margo’nun her şeyi bu kadar detaylı ve kesin olarak planlamasının nedeni belki de bu duyguydu, diye düşünürken buldum kendimi: Gitmek isteseniz bile, bu öyle zordu ki. Hazırlanmak gerekiyordu ve belki de abşveriş merkezinde oturup planlarım karalamak hem zihinsel hem de duygusal alıştırmaydı... Margo’nun kaderini yaşarkenki halini hayal etme yoluydu.
es: A lo largo del día me descubrí pensando que quizá aquel sentimiento era la razón por la que Margo lo había planificado todo de forma tan compleja y precisa. Aunque quieras marcharte, es muy difícil. Necesitó preparación, y quizá sentarse en aquel centro comercial a escribir sus planes era una labor tanto intelectual como emocional, su manera de imaginarse a sí misma en su destino.
vi_translation: All day long, I had thought that perhaps this emotion was the reason why she planned everything so meticulously and precisely: even if you want to go, leaving is still very difficult. It needs to be prepared, and perhaps sitting down to plan in that abandoned shopping mall was both an intellectual and emotional task—the way Margo envisioned herself embarking on her destiny.
tr_translation: Throughout the day, I found myself thinking that perhaps this was the reason Margo planned everything so meticulously and precisely: Even if you wanted to leave, it was so difficult. You had to prepare, and maybe sitting in the shopping mall scribbling my plans was both a mental and emotional exercise... A way to imagine Margo living out her destiny.
es_translation: Throughout the day, I found myself thinking that perhaps that feeling was the reason why Margo had planned everything so complexly and precisely. Even if you want to leave, it is very difficult. It required preparation, and perhaps sitting in that shopping mall to write her plans was both an intellectual and emotional task, her way of imagining herself at her destination.

en: I was already up and paging through travel guides when my parents came into my room on Friday morning. They rarely both entered the room at the same time, and I felt a ripple of nausea—maybe they had bad news about Margo—before I remembered it was my graduation day.
vi: Sáng thứ Sáu, tôi đã dậy và đang lật giở các cuốn hướng dẫn du lịch thì bố mẹ vào phòng tôi. Cả hai hiếm khi cùng vào phòng tôi một lúc, tôi chớm cảm thấy nhộn nhạo trong người–hay là có tin không hay về Margo–rồi chợt nhớ ra hôm nay là ngày tôi tốt nghiệp.
tr: Cuma günü annemle babam odama girdiğinde çoktan kalkmış, seyahat rehberlerinin sayfalarını çeviriyordum. İkisi nadiren aynı anda odama girerdi ve mezuniyet günüm olduğunu hatırlamadan önce, bir mide bulantısı dalgası hissettim... Belki de Margo hakkında kötü haberleri vardı.
es: El viernes por la mañana estaba ya levantado, hojeando guías de viajes, cuando mis padres entraron en mi habitación. Como rara vez entraban los dos juntos, me dio un vuelco el estómago —quizá tenían malas noticias de Margo—, pero de pronto recordé que era el día de mi graduación.
vi_translation: On Friday morning, I had woken up and was flipping through travel guides when my parents came into my room. Both of them rarely came into my room at the same time, I started to feel uneasy—maybe there was bad news about Margo—then suddenly remembered that today was my graduation day.
tr_translation: When my mom and dad entered my room on Friday, I had already gotten up and was flipping through the pages of travel guides. They rarely entered my room at the same time, and before I remembered that it was my graduation day, I felt a wave of nausea... Maybe they had bad news about Margo.
es_translation: On Friday morning, I was already up, leafing through travel guides, when my parents entered my room. Since they rarely came in together, my stomach turned —maybe they had bad news about Margo—, but then I suddenly remembered it was my graduation day.

en: But is it the kind of thing she likes to actually do? No. Because Margo knows the secret of leaving, the secret I have only just now learned: leaving feels good and pure only when you leave something important, something that mattered to you. Pulling life out by the roots. But you can’t do that until your life has grown roots.
vi: Nhưng đó có phải thể loại việc cô ấy thích thực sự thực hiện không? Không. Vì Margo biết bí mật của sự ra đi, cái bí mật tôi vừa mới hiểu được: sự ra đi chỉ tuyệt diệu và thuần khiết khi ta rời bỏ điều gì đó quan trọng, điều gì đó có ý nghĩa với ta. Kéo bật sự sống lên từ gốc rễ. Nhưng ta không thể làm như vậy cho đến khi cuộc đời ta đã bén rễ.
tr: Ama gerçekten yapmaktan hoşlanacağı türde bir şey mi? Hayır. Çünkü Margo bir yeri terk etmenin sırrım biliyor, benim ancak şimdi öğrendiğim sim: Terk etmek, yalnızca önemli bir yer, an lamı olan bir yer terk edildiğinde iyi ve saf hissettiriyor. Hayatı köklerinden çekip çıkarmak gibi. Ama bunu, hayat kök salmadıkça yapmak mümkün değil.
es: Pero ¿es el tipo de cosas que realmente le gusta hacer? No. Porque Margo conoce el secreto de marcharse, el secreto que yo acabo de aprender: marcharse te hace sentirte bien y es auténtico solo cuando dejas atrás algo importante, algo que te importaba. Arrancar la vida desde la raíz. Pero no puedes hacerlo mientras tu vida no haya echado raíces.
vi_translation: But is that the kind of work she really likes to do? No. Because Margo knows the secret of leaving, the secret I have just understood: leaving is only wonderful and pure when you leave something important, something meaningful to you. Uprooting life from its roots. But you can't do that until your life has taken root.
tr_translation: But is it really the kind of thing she would enjoy doing? No. Because Margo knows the secret of leaving a place, a secret I have only now learned: Leaving is only about an important place, a moment When a place with a soul is abandoned, it feels good and pure. Like uprooting life from its roots. But this is not possible until life has taken root.
es_translation: But is it the kind of thing that he really likes to do? No. Because Margo knows the secret of leaving, the secret that I have just learned: leaving makes you feel good and is only authentic when you leave behind something important, something that mattered to you. es: —Muy bien —le contesto. El hecho de que Margo pierda totalmente los papeles hace que yo recupere los míos. Intento hablar como mi madre. —Me callo. Estamos los dos enfadados. Por mi parte… hay muchas cosas sin resolver.
vi_translation: "Okay," I said. Something in the completely uncontrolled emotional outburst of Margo made me hold myself back. I tried to speak like my mother. "I will be silent. Neither of us is happy. There are still many, um, unresolved issues from my side."
tr_translation: “Okay,” I say. Something about Margo completely losing her patience helps me regain mine. I try to talk like my mom. “I will shut up, we are both in a mess. From my perspective, there are a lot of unresolved issues.”
es_translation: —Very well —I answered him. The fact that Margo completely loses her composure makes me regain mine. I try to speak like my mother. —I remain silent. We are both angry. As for me... there are many unresolved issues.

en: “How can you separate those things, though? The people are the place is the people. And anyway, I didn’t think there was anybody else to be friends with. I thought everyone was either scared, like you, or oblivious, like Lacey. And th—”
vi: “Sao cậu có thể phân tách hai mặt đó được chứ? Người là đất và đất là người. Dù sao, tớ không nghĩ có thể đánh bạn với ai khác. Tớ nghĩ mọi người hoặc là sợ sệt như cậu, hoặc là vô tâm như Lacey. Và–”
tr: “Bunları birbirinden nasıl ayırabilirsin ki? insanlar mekândır, mekân da insanlar. Her neyse, arkadaş olunacak başka kimse olmadığını sanıyordum. Herkesin ya senin gibi korkak ya da Lacey gibi duyarsız olduğunu sanıyordum. Ve...
es: —¿Cómo puedes separar una cosa de la otra? La gente es el sitio, y el sitio es la gente. Y bueno, no pensaba que hubiera nadie más de quien pudiera ser amiga. Pensaba que todos estaban asustados, como tú, o que les daba igual, como a Lacey. Y…
vi_translation: “How can you separate those two sides? People are the land and the land is people. Anyway, I don't think I can be friends with anyone else. I think everyone is either scared like you, or indifferent like Lacey. And–”
tr_translation: “How can you separate these from each other? People are places, and places are people. Anyway, I thought there was no one else to be friends with. I thought everyone was either a coward like you or insensitive like Lacey. And...”
es_translation: —How can you separate one thing from the other? The people are the place, and the place is the people. And well, I didn't think there was anyone else I could be friends with. I thought everyone was either scared, like you, or didn't care, like Lacey. And...

en: “Sorry,” I say, pushing aside some knee-high yellow-green grass to pick up the phone. “Nice to talk to Ruthie, though?”
vi: “Tớ rất tiếc,” tôi nói, vén thứ cỏ nửa vàng nửa xanh cao đến đầu gối ra để nhặt điện thoại lên. “Nhưng nói chuyện với Ruthie thì vui chứ?”
tr: “Üzgünüm,” diyorum, telefonu almak için diz boyundaki sarıyeşil çimenleri bir kenara iterken. “Ruthie’yle konuşmak iyi miydi?” “Evet, Ruthie sevimli bir kız.
es: —Lo siento —le digo apartando la hierba amarillenta, que nos llega a las rodillas, para coger el teléfono—. Pero ¿bien con Ruthie?
vi_translation: “I'm very sorry,” I said, pushing aside the knee-high grass, half yellow and half green, to pick up the phone. “But was it fun talking to Ruthie?”
tr_translation: “I'm sorry,” I say, pushing aside the knee-high yellow-green grass to get the phone. “Was it good to talk to Ruthie?” “Yes, Ruthie is a lovely girl.
es_translation: —I'm sorry —I say, pushing aside the yellowish grass that reaches our knees to pick up the phone—. But everything okay with Ruthie?

en: “I didn’t realize my job was to please you, Mrs. Spiegelman.”
vi: “Tôi không biết hóa ra việc của tôi là phải làm hài lòng cô đấy, thưa cô Spiegelman.
tr: “işimin seni memnun etmek olduğunu fark etmemiştim, Bayan Spiegelman.
es: —No sabía que lo que tenía que hacer era complacerla, señorita Spiegelman.
vi_translation: "I didn't know it turned out my job was to please you, Ms. Spiegelman."
tr_translation: “I hadn't realized that my job was to please you, Ms. Spiegelman.”
es_translation: —I didn't know that what I had to do was to please you, Miss Spiegelman.

en: “No, you don’t,” she answers, and she’s right. She can see it in my face—I understand now that I can’t be her and she can’t be me. Maybe Whitman had a gift I don’t have. But as for me: I must ask the wounded man where he is hurt, because I cannot become the wounded man. The only wounded man I can be is me.
vi: “Không đâu, cậu không nghĩ như vậy đâu,” Margo đáp, và cô ấy nói đúng. Cô ấy có thể thấy được điều đó trên mặt tôi–giờ tôi hiểu rằng mình không thể là cô ấy và cô ấy không thể là tôi. Có lẽ Whitman có một cái tài mà tôi không có. Đối với tôi: Tôi phải hỏi người mang vết thương xem anh ta bị đau ở đâu, vì tôi không thể trở thành người mang vết thương. Người mang vết thương duy nhất mà tôi có thể ở trong, chính là tôi.
tr: “Hayır, düşünmüyorsun,” diye cevap veriyor ve haklı. Yüzümden okuyabiliyor... benim o ve onun da ben olamayacağını şimdi anlıyorum. Belki Whitman’da bende olmayan bir yetenek vardı. Ama ben yaralı adama neresinin acıdığını sormalıyım çünkü ben yaralı adam olamam. Olabileceğim tek yaralı adam benim.
es: —No, no lo crees —me contesta. Y tiene razón. Me lo ve en la cara. Por fin entiendo que no puedo ser ella, y que ella no puede ser yo. Quizá Whitman tenía un don que yo no tengo. Por lo que a mí respecta, tengo que preguntarle al herido dónde tiene la herida, porque no puedo convertirme en el herido. El único herido que puedo ser es yo mismo.
vi_translation: “No, you don't think that way,” Margo replied, and she was right. She could see it on my face–now I understand that I can't be her and she can't be me. Maybe Whitman has a talent that I don't have. For me: I have to ask the wounded person where he is hurt, because I can't become the wounded person. The only wounded person I can be is myself.
tr_translation: “No, you are not thinking,” he replies, and he is right. He can read it from my face... I now understand that I cannot be him and he cannot be me. Maybe Whitman had a talent that I did not possess. But I must ask the wounded man where it hurts because I cannot be the wounded man. The only wounded man I can be is myself.
es_translation: —No, you don't believe it —he replies to me. And he is right. He sees it in my face. At last, I understand that I cannot be her, and that she cannot be me. Maybe Whitman had a gift that I do not have. As far as I am concerned, I have to ask the wounded where the wound is, because I cannot become the wounded. The only wounded person I can be is myself.

en: I shrug. “Yeah, I know. I’m not saying that everything is survivable. Just that everything except the last thing is.” I dig my hand in again, the dirt here so much blacker than back home. I toss a handful into the pile behind us, and sit back. I feel on the edge of an idea, and I try to talk my way into it. I have never spoken this many words in a row to Margo in our long and storied relationship, but here it is, my last play for her.
vi: Tôi nhún vai. “Ừ, tớ biết. Tớ không nói rằng mọi thứ đều sống mãi được. Chỉ là, mọi thứ trừ thứ cuối cùng ra.” Tôi lại sục tay đào tiếp, đất ở đây đen hơn ở nhà nhiều. Tôi thêm một vốc đầy vào đống đất sau lưng, và ngồi xuống. Tôi cảm thấy như đang mon men gần một suy nghĩ, và tôi cố gắng đi vào sâu trong nó. Tôi chưa từng một mạch nói nhiều như thế này với Margo, xét trong mối quan hệ dài và được viết thành truyện giữa chúng tôi. Nhưng nó đây rồi, trò chơi cuối cùng của tôi dành cho cô ấy.
tr: Omuzlarımı silkiyorum. “Evet, biliyorum. Her şeyin dayanılabilir olduğunu söylemiyorum. Sadece son şey hariç her şey dayanılabilir.” Elimi tekrar toprağa sokuyorum, buradaki toprak evdekinden çok daha koyu renkli. Arkamızdaki yığma bir avuç dolusu toprak atıyorum ve geri oturuyorum. Bir fikrin eşiğinde olduğumu hissediyorum ve konuşarak içine girmeye çalışıyorum. Uzun ve hikâyelerle dolu ilişkimizde, Margo’ya art arda hiç bu kadar çok kelime söylememiştim ama işte, onun için son oyunum.
es: Me encojo de hombros. —Sí, lo sé. No estoy diciendo que pueda sobrevivirse a todo. Solo que puede sobrevivirse a todo, menos a lo último. Vuelvo a hundir la mano. La tierra aquí es mucho más oscura que en Orlando. Lanzo un puñado a la pila que está detrás de nosotros y me siento. Se me está ocurriendo una idea e intento abrirme camino hacia ella. Nunca he dicho tantas palabras seguidas a Margo en nuestra larga y notoria relación, pero ahí va, mi última actuación para ella.
vi_translation: I shrugged. "Yeah, I know. I'm not saying everything can live forever. It's just that, everything except the last thing." I dug my hands in again, the soil here was much darker than at home. I added another handful to the pile of dirt behind me, and sat down. I felt like I was on the verge of a thought, and I tried to delve deeper into it. I've never talked this much at once with Margo, considering our long and storied relationship. But here it was, my final game for her.
tr_translation: I shrug my shoulders. "Yes, I know. I'm not saying everything is bearable. Just that everything except the last thing is bearable." I put my hand back into the soil, the soil here is much darker than at home. I throw a handful of soil behind us and sit back down. I feel like I'm on the verge of an idea and try to get into it by talking. In our long and story-filled relationship, I have never said so many words to Margo in succession, but here it is, my last game for her.
es_translation: I shrug my shoulders. —Yes, I know. I'm not saying that one can survive everything. Just that one can survive everything, except the last thing. I sink my hand again. The soil here is much darker than in Orlando. I throw a handful onto the pile behind us and sit down. An idea is occurring to me, and I try to make my way towards it. I have never said so many words in a row to Margo in our long and notorious relationship, but here it goes, my last performance for her.

en: “Godspeed, Robert Joyner,” I say, and drop a handful of dirt onto the notebook.
vi: “Hãy bình an nhé, bác Robert Joyner,” tôi nói, thả một nắm đất lên cuốn sổ.
tr: “Tanrı yanında olsun, Robert Joyner,” diyorum ve bir avuç dolusu toprağı defterin üzerine atıyorum.
es: Ve con Dios, Robert Joyner. Lanzo un puñado de tierra sobre la libreta.
vi_translation: "Rest in peace, Mr. Robert Joyner," I said, dropping a handful of soil onto the notebook.
tr_translation: “May God be with you, Robert Joyner,” I say, and throw a handful of soil onto the notebook.
es_translation: Go with God, Robert Joyner. I throw a handful of dirt onto the notebook.

en: I feel her hands on my back. And it is dark as I kiss her, but I have my eyes open and so does Margo. She is close enough to me that I can see her, because even now there is the outward sign of the invisible light, even at night in this parking lot on the outskirts of Agloe. After we kiss, our foreheads touch as we stare at each other. Yes, I can see her almost perfectly in this cracked darkness.
vi: Tôi cảm thấy bàn tay Margo trên lưng mình. Trời đã đổ tối khi tôi hôn cô ấy, nhưng tôi mở mắt và Margo cũng vậy. Cô ấy ở đủ gần để tôi có thể thấy được cô ấy, vì giờ có một thứ ánh sáng vô hình từ bên trong, dù vào buổi tối trên bãi đỗ xe này ở ngoại ô Agloe. Nụ hôn dứt, chúng tôi áp trán lại và nhìn vào nhau. Đúng vậy, tôi có thể thấy được cô ấy gần như hoàn hảo trong bóng tối nứt rạn này.
tr: Sırtımda ellerini hissediyorum. Onu öperken hava karanlık fakat gözlerimi açık tutuyorum, Margo da oyla Onu görebileceğim kadar yakınımda, şu anda, Agloe’nun dışındaki bu park alanındaki gecede bile o görünmez ışığın görünür işaretleri var. Öpüştükten sonra uzun uzun bakışırken alınlarımız birbirine değiyor. Bu çatlakları olan karanlıkta onu neredeyse kusursuz bir şekilde görebiliyorum.
es: Siento sus manos en mi espalda. Y aunque está oscuro, no cierro los ojos mientras la beso, y Margo tampoco. Está tan cerca de mí que puedo verla, porque incluso ahora aparece el signo externo de la luz invisible, incluso por la noche en este aparcamiento a las afueras de Agloe. Después de besarnos nos miramos tan de cerca que nuestras frentes se tocan. Sí, la veo casi a la perfección en esta agrietada oscuridad.
vi_translation: I felt Margo's hand on my back. It had already turned dark when I kissed her, but I opened my eyes and so did Margo. She was close enough for me to see her, as there was now an invisible light from within, even in the evening in this parking lot on the outskirts of Agloe. The kiss ended, we pressed our foreheads together and looked at each other. Yes, I could see her almost perfectly in this fractured darkness.
tr_translation: I feel her hands on my back. While kissing her, the air is dark but I keep my eyes open, Margo too, so close that I can see her, even in this night at the parking lot outside Agloe, there are visible signs of that invisible light. After kissing, as we look at each other for a long time, our foreheads touch. In this darkness with cracks, I can see her almost perfectly.
es_translation: I feel her hands on my back. And even though it's dark, I don't close my eyes while I kiss her, and neither does Margo. She is so close to me that I can see her, because even now the external sign of invisible light appears, even at night in this parking lot on the outskirts of Agloe. After kissing, we look at each other so closely that our foreheads touch. Yes, I see her almost perfectly in this cracked darkness.
